text: Acridocarpus socotranus is a species of plant in the family Malpighiaceae. It is endemic to Socotra, an archipelago which is part of Yemen. It occurs in woodlands, thickets, and succulent shrubland habitat, where it is a common species. The plant is a shrub or small tree with leathery leaves, yellow flowers, and winged fruits. ==References== Category:Malpighiaceae Category:Endemic flora of Socotra Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Taxa named by Daniel Oliver
title: Acridocarpus socotranus
